Comments_List: Really useful continuation of my college Spanish education. Felt like a good increase in rigor from L1 but was still manageable. Gained even more of an appreciation of the nuance that comes with learning any language.
I learned more about spanish language and culture
Comprehensive activities to practice the material, but some were redundant
Too much bookwork, not much speaking in Spanish

Sometimes it feels a little rushed and not enough time in class for practice. This is all assuming that you aren't spending much time actually speaking outside of class, which I think is the case for most students. I would say integrating more speaking and listening into homework would be extremely helpful since we are assessed on these skills.
Yes! would highly recommend- definitely helps you learn Spanish.

Yes, I would. Not only because the student is likely required to be in this course, but also because this course gives you the opportunity to really start understanding how the language works in a way that I don't think was as obvious in L1.
